product_overview: A unified web application combining a high-performance public portfolio site with an integrated administration dashboard for managing creative projects, clients, and global site settings. Built on Laravel with Livewire and FilamentPHP, it offers a seamless content management experience and dynamic portfolio presentation.
core_goals: Provide a visually appealing and responsive public portfolio showcasing projects with media support and client endorsements.
Enable efficient content management with an intuitive admin dashboard for creating, editing, and organizing portfolio projects and client logos.
Centralize global site configurations for hero sections, SEO settings, and contact information to streamline site maintenance without code changes.
Ensure high performance and smooth user experience with lazy loading media, auto-playing videos, and responsive grid layouts.
Implement security and visibility controls to manage published vs draft content effectively.
key_features: Public Landing Page with hero video, project gallery in dynamic grid layouts, client carousel, and footer with contact info.
Project Management CRUD with rich text description, media upload (images, videos), drag-and-drop media and project ordering, SEO metadata, and visibility toggles.
Client Management CRUD for uploading logos, reordering carousel display, setting website URLs, and visibility toggles.
Global Site Settings singleton for managing hero content, social links, SEO defaults, and profile information.
Media storage supporting local filesystem management with external URL resolution checks.
Responsive UI components using Tailwind CSS, Blade templates, Livewire, and Alpine.js.
Admin panel powered by FilamentPHP for rapid resource management with listing, creating, editing, and deleting operations.
user_flow_summary: Public visitors land on the portfolio homepage where they see an auto-playing hero video, followed by projects displayed in a responsive grid with media cards and a client logos carousel.
Visitors interact with media cards to view high-resolution images or videos in a lightbox/modal interface.
Admin users log into the FilamentPHP admin dashboard to manage projects: create new entries, upload and reorder media, set SEO metadata, and toggle visibility between draft and published.
Admin users manage client logos by uploading images, setting optional website links, and ordering the carousel display.
Site administrators update global site settings such as hero video, profile bio, social links, and SEO defaults via a centralized settings page.
Changes made in the admin dashboard are immediately reflected on the public site with optimistic UI updates where applicable.
validation_criteria: Public portfolio renders correctly with videos auto-playing and media images displayed in appropriate grid layouts.
Drag-and-drop reordering of projects and media items persist and reflect in the frontend display order.
Admin CRUD operations (create, edit, delete) for projects, clients, and site settings function without errors.
Visibility toggles effectively hide draft content from public view while showing published content.
Media uploads validate file types and sizes; media URLs resolve correctly for local and external storage cases.
SEO metadata fields are saved and reflected in page meta tags in the public site.
The client logo carousel animates smoothly with configured logos and maintains responsive design.
Performance benchmarks are met for page load times and media lazy loading is implemented.
UI adheres to responsive design principles and accessibility standards.
All routes and API endpoints are secure with authentication and authorization restrictions in place.
